titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Woodside Country Club Collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection pertains to a proposed golf course to be built by the Woodside Country Club, partly on lands owned by Stanford University; included are photocopies of correspondence with Stanford officials (1926-30), photocopy of the membership booklet of the Country Club, photocopies of several maps (1926), and Gordon Ratliff's essay "Woodside Country Club MacKenzie's Dream," 2006.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Woodside Country Club Collection (SCM0308). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection pertains to a proposed golf course to be built by the Woodside Country Club, partly on lands owned by Stanford University; included are photocopies of correspondence with Stanford officials (1926-30), photocopy of the membership booklet of the Country Club, photocopies of several maps (1926), and Gordon Ratliff's essay "Woodside Country Club MacKenzie's Dream," 2006.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection pertains to a proposed golf course to be built by the Woodside Country Club, partly on lands owned by Stanford University; included are photocopies of correspondence with Stanford officials (1926-30), photocopy of the membership booklet of the Country Club, photocopies of several maps (1926), and Gordon Ratliff's essay "Woodside Country Club MacKenzie's Dream," 2006.
